required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Phase II Trial of Letrozole With or Without Dasatinib as First and Second-line Treatment for Hormone Receptor-positive, HER2-negative Post-menopausal Breast Cancer That is Unresectable, Locally Recurrent or Metastatic
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Phase II Trial of Letrozole With or Without Dasatinib as First and Second-line Treatment for Hormone Receptor-positive, HER2-negative Post-menopausal Breast Cancer That is Unresectable, Locally Recurrent or Metastatic

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to find out what effect the combination of letrozole (brand name: Femara) and dasatinib (brand name: Sprycel) has on metastatic breast cancer compared to letrozole alone

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinical Benefit (CBR) and Number of Participants With CBR Having a Disease Free Interval (DFI) Greater Than 2 Years - Evaluable Population
primary_outcome.time_frame: First dose of study drug to last dose plus 7 days, up to study completion (approximately 6 years)
primary_outcome.description: CBR=participants with complete response (CR) + participants with partial response (PR) + participants with stable disease (SD) for a length of time greater than, equal to 6 months. CR= Disappearance of all target lesions. No new lesions. PR= At least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum LD. SD= Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for progressive disease (PD) taking as reference the smallest sum LD since the treatment started. Physical examination,radiological assessment, and bone scans (if applicable) were used to assess outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Complete Response, Partial Response, Stable Disease, and Disease Progression
secondary_outcome.time_frame: First dose of study drug to last dose plus 7 days, up to study completion (approximately 6 years)
secondary_outcome.description: CR= Disappearance of all target lesions. No new lesions. PR= At least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum LD. SD= Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for progressive disease (PD) taking as reference the smallest sum LD since the treatment started. Progression (PD): At least a 20% increase in the sum of LD of target lesions taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Progression Free Survival (PFS) - Intent to Treat (ITT) Population
secondary_outcome.description: PFS was measured in months. Progression=At least a 20% increase in the sum of LD of target lesions taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions. Study initiated 2008 and completed 2014.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Best Overall Response After Change From Letrozole to Letrozole Plus Dasatinib
secondary_outcome.time_frame: First dose of study drug to last dose plus 7 days, up to study completion (approximately 6 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants in single-agent letrozole treatment arm who developed progressive disease, could continue letrozole, and add dasatinib to their treatment regimen. CBR=participants with CR + participants with partial response (PR) + participants with SD for a length of time ≥6 months divided by the total number of participants (%). CR= Disappearance of all target lesions. No new lesions. PR= At least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum LD. SD= Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for progressive disease (PD) taking as reference the smallest sum LD since the treatment started. PD=At least a 20% increase in the sum of LD of target lesions taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With PFS At 6 Months and At 12 Months - ITT Population
secondary_outcome.description: Progression=At least a 20% increase in the sum of LD of target lesions taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions. ITT population: from time of first enrollment to first PD for all ITT participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Time to Treatment Failure (TTF) - ITT Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: First dose of study drug to last dose plus 7 days, up to study completion (approximately 6 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to TTF was measured in months. The number of participants with events (PD or off treatment due to any reason) was evaluated. The first PD was defined as the event for cross over participants in the single- agent letrozole treatment arm to add dasatinib to their regimen.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) Leading to Discontinuation, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), and Deaths
secondary_outcome.time_frame: First dose of study drug to last dose plus 30 days, up to study completion (approximately 6 years)
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a preexisting condition that may not have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE=a medical event that at any dose results in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; is life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or requires or prolongs hospitalization.

intervention.description: Tablets, Oral, 100 mg once daily, up to 2 years
Tablets, Oral, 2.5 mg, once daily, up to 2 years

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding BMS clinical trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com.
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has histologic or cytologic diagnosis of breast cancer; evidence of unresectable locally recurrent or metastatic disease
- Has measurable or evaluable-only disease
- Is female, ≥18 yrs of age, post menopausal or surgically sterile
- HER2 negative, HR+, ER+ and/or PgR+ breast cancer
- 0-1 prior chemotherapy regimen for metastatic disease.
- Prior adjuvant or neoadjuvant chemotherapy completed at least 1 month prior
- Prior tamoxifen therapy is allowed
- No AI therapy for >1 year without recurrence
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or breast feeding
- Prior hormonal therapy for metastatic or locally recurrent disease
- >1 chemotherapy regimen for metastatic disease
- Pleural or pericardial effusion
- Serious cardiac condition

facility.name: Arizona Oncology Associates D.B.A. Hematology Oncology
Texas Cancer Center At Medical City
El Paso Cancer Treatment Ctr - East
Cancer Care Centers Of South Texas

Texas Oncology Cancer Care And Research Center

Yakima Valley Memorial Hospital/North Star Lodge

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Study started October 2008 and completed June 2014; 23 participants chose to remain on active treatment after the study completed.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 120 participants were enrolled, randomized and treated.

group.title: Dasatinib Plus Letrozole
group.description: Dasatinib + Letrozole: Tablets, Oral, once daily, up to 2 years Dasatinib 100 mg + Letrozole 2.5 mg Tablets, once daily up to 2 years. If a participant experienced intolerable toxicity related to dasatinib, they had the option to crossover to letrozole arm.

group.title: Letrozole
group.description: Participants received letrozole 2.5 mg tablets, once daily, up to 2 years. If the participant developed progressive disease while on the single agent, the participant had the option to add dasatinib to their treatment regimen.

group.title: Dasatinib Plus Letrozole
group.description: Dasatinib + Letrozole: Tablets, Oral, once daily, up to 2 years Dasatinib 100 mg + Letrozole 2.5 mg

group.title: Letrozole
group.description: Letrozole: Tablets, Oral, 2.5 mg, once daily, up to 2 years

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

class.title: Greater than or equal to 65 years

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Clinical Benefit (CBR) and Number of Participants With CBR Having a Disease Free Interval (DFI) Greater Than 2 Years - Evaluable Population
outcome.description: CBR=participants with complete response (CR) + participants with partial response (PR) + participants with stable disease (SD) for a length of time greater than, equal to 6 months. CR= Disappearance of all target lesions. No new lesions. PR= At least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum LD. SD= Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for progressive disease (PD) taking as reference the smallest sum LD since the treatment started. Physical examination,radiological assessment, and bone scans (if applicable) were used to assess outcome.
outcome.time_frame: First dose of study drug to last dose plus 7 days, up to study completion (approximately 6 years)
outcome.population: Evaluable Population was defined as all treated participants who met the protocol-specified efficacy analyses requirements and who received at least 1 dose of randomized study drug. Participants presented in the treatment arm to which they were originally randomized.

group.title: Dasatinib Plus Letrozole
group.description: Dasatinib + Letrozole: Tablets, Oral, once daily, up to 2 years Dasatinib 100 mg + Letrozole 2.5 mg Patients on letrozole plus dasatinib received both drugs until progressive disease (PD) or intolerable toxicity. If the intolerable toxicity was determined to be related to dasatinib, dasatinib was discontinued and the patient continued on single-agent letrozole. Although drugs were taken daily, cycle length was 28-days

group.title: Letrozole
group.description: Letrozole: Tablets, Oral, 2.5 mg, once daily, up to 2 years Patients on letrozole who developed progressive disease continued letrozole, and dasatinib was added to their treatment regimen. Although drugs were taken daily, cycle length was 28-days

measure.title: Number of Participants With Clinical Benefit (CBR) and Number of Participants With CBR Having a Disease Free Interval (DFI) Greater Than 2 Years - Evaluable Population
measure.description: CBR=participants with complete response (CR) + participants with partial response (PR) + participants with stable disease (SD) for a length of time greater than, equal to 6 months. CR= Disappearance of all target lesions. No new lesions. PR= At least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum LD. SD= Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for progressive disease (PD) taking as reference the smallest sum LD since the treatment started. Physical examination,radiological assessment, and bone scans (if applicable) were used to assess outcome.

PR= At least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum LD. SD= Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for progressive disease (PD) taking as reference the smallest sum LD since the treatment started. Progression (PD): At least a 20% increase in the sum of LD of target lesions taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: First dose of study drug to last dose plus 7 days, up to study completion (approximately 6 years)
outcome.population: All treated participants who met the protocol-specified efficacy analyses requirements and who received at least 1 dose of study drug were analyzed. The participants are analyzed as per the treatment arm to which they were originally randomized.

outcome.population: ITT population includes all participants enrolled in the study. The participants were analyzed as per the treatment arm to which they were originally randomized.

measure.description: PFS was measured in months. Progression=At least a 20% increase in the sum of LD of target lesions taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions. Study initiated 2008 and completed 2014.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Best Overall Response After Change From Letrozole to Letrozole Plus Dasatinib
outcome.description: Participants in single-agent letrozole treatment arm who developed progressive disease, could continue letrozole, and add dasatinib to their treatment regimen. CBR=participants with CR + participants with partial response (PR) + participants with SD for a length of time ≥6 months divided by the total number of participants (%). CR= Disappearance of all target lesions. No new lesions. PR= At least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum LD. SD= Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for progressive disease (PD) taking as reference the smallest sum LD since the treatment started. PD=At least a 20% increase in the sum of LD of target lesions taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: First dose of study drug to last dose plus 7 days, up to study completion (approximately 6 years)
outcome.population: Participants who changed their treatment regimen from single-agent letrozole to letrozole + dasatinib during the study.

group.title: Crossed Over From Letrozole to Letrozole + Dasatinib
group.description: These participants were randomized to receive letrozole 2.5 mg PO once daily. After developing progressive disease they continued letrozole, and were permitted to add 100 mg PO once daily dasatinib to their treatment regimen.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Best Overall Response After Change From Letrozole to Letrozole Plus Dasatinib
measure.description: Participants in single-agent letrozole treatment arm who developed progressive disease, could continue letrozole, and add dasatinib to their treatment regimen. CBR=participants with CR + participants with partial response (PR) + participants with SD for a length of time ≥6 months divided by the total number of participants (%). CR= Disappearance of all target lesions. No new lesions. PR= At least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum LD. SD= Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for progressive disease (PD) taking as reference the smallest sum LD since the treatment started. PD=At least a 20% increase in the sum of LD of target lesions taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions.
measure.population: Participants who changed their treatment regimen from single-agent letrozole to letrozole + dasatinib during the study.

outcome.description: Progression=At least a 20% increase in the sum of LD of target lesions taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions. ITT population: from time of first enrollment to first PD for all ITT participants.
outcome.population: ITT population=Includes all participants registered on the study. n= number at risk

outcome.description: AE=any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a preexisting condition that may not have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE=a medical event that at any dose results in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; is life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or requires or prolongs hospitalization.

outcome.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug were summarized. The participants were analyzed as per the treatment arm to which they were originally randomized.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
